cloud_security_risks.name: Broken Access Control
cloud_security_risks.description: Occurs when cloud resources are not properly secured, allowing unauthorized users to access sensitive data or perform unauthorized actions.
mitigation: Implement strong authentication and authorization mechanisms
Use role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict access based on user roles and responsibilities
Regularly review and update access control policies
Monitor for suspicious activity and unauthorized access attempts

cloud_security_risks.name: Misconfiguration and Inadequate Change Control
cloud_security_risks.description: Misconfigured cloud services and inadequate change control processes that expose systems to vulnerabilities and breaches.
impact: Unauthorized access to systems and data
Loss of data or system integrity
mitigation: Establish secure configuration baselines for cloud services
Implement automated security configuration tools
Use infrastructure as code (IaC) to manage and automate cloud infrastructure configurations
Implement a robust change management process to track and approve changes

cloud_security_risks.name: Insecure Interfaces and APIs
cloud_security_risks.description: Insecure APIs and interfaces that allow attackers to exploit vulnerabilities and gain unauthorized access.
mitigation: Securely design and implement APIs with strong authentication and authorization
Validate all input to prevent injection attacks
Regularly test APIs for vulnerabilities using security testing tools
Implement rate limiting and input validation to mitigate DoS attacks

cloud_security_risks.name: Vulnerable and Outdated Components
cloud_security_risks.description: Using vulnerable or outdated components in cloud applications introduces security risks.
impact: Loss of data or system integrity
mitigation: Regularly update and patch all components including OS, libraries, and applications
Use vulnerability scanning tools to identify and fix vulnerabilities
Implement process for tracking and managing component dependencies
Consider containerization to isolate applications and dependencies

cloud_security_risks.name: Data Loss and Leakage
cloud_security_risks.description: Loss or leakage of data due to accidental deletion, misconfiguration, or malicious attacks.
mitigation: Implement strong data security policies and procedures
Encrypt data at rest and in transit
Use data loss prevention (DLP) tools to monitor and prevent leakage
Regularly back up data and ensure backups are securely stored

cloud_security_risks.name: Insufficient Identity, Credential, Access, and Key Management
cloud_security_risks.description: Poor management of identities, credentials, access rights, and encryption keys.
impact: Loss of control over cloud resources
mitigation: Implement strong password policies and multi-factor authentication
Use centralized identity and access management (IAM)
Regularly rotate credentials and keys
Apply least privilege access principles

cloud_security_risks.name: Account Hijacking
cloud_security_risks.description: Attackers gain unauthorized access to user accounts controlling cloud resources and data.
mitigation: Implement strong authentication mechanisms like MFA
Monitor for suspicious login attempts and account activity
Educate users about phishing and social engineering
Implement account lockout policies after multiple failed login attempts

cloud_security_risks.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
cloud_security_risks.description: Attackers trick servers into making unauthorized requests to internal or external resources.
impact: Access to internal systems and resources
mitigation: Validate all user-supplied input to prevent SSRF
Sanitize URLs and limit allowed protocols and domains
Implement network segmentation to restrict internal access
Use web application firewalls (WAF) to detect and block SSRF

cloud_security_risks.name: Use of Insecure Third-Party Components
cloud_security_risks.description: Use of insecure third-party components introduces vulnerabilities.
impact: Loss of data or system integrity
mitigation: Vet and select third-party components carefully based on security posture
Regularly update and patch third-party components
Use vulnerability scanning tools on third-party components
Isolate third-party components from sensitive systems and data

cloud_security_risks.name: System Data Exposure
cloud_security_risks.description: Sensitive data like configuration files or logs are not properly protected and accessible to unauthorized users.
mitigation: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit
Implement access controls restricting access to sensitive data
Regularly review and update data security policies
Monitor for unauthorized access attempts
